title: How to Convert an AIFF File to a WAV File

steps.headline: Open Online-Convert.com in your internet browser.
steps.description: Type www.online-convert.com into the address bar, and hit ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard. This is a free, online file converter website. If you're not a fan of Online-Convert.com, you can easily find other file converter websites with a quick Google search.

steps.headline: Click the drop-down menu under "Audio converter."
steps.description: You can find the audio converter box in the upper-left corner of the page. The drop-down is labeled as Select target format.

steps.headline: Select Convert to WAV.
steps.description: This will open a new page titled "Convert audio to WAV."

steps.headline: Click the Choose File button.
steps.description: You can find this button under the "Upload your audio you want to convert to WAV" heading near the top of the page. Alternatively, you can paste a URL link to convert an online file, or select one of the cloud storage options and upload a file from Dropbox or Google Drive.

steps.headline: Upload the audio file you want to convert.
steps.description: Select the AIFF file you want to convert in the dialogue box, and click Open.

steps.headline: Click the Convert file button.
steps.description: It's located towards the bottom of the page. This will upload your AIFF audio file, and start converting it to WAV. You'll see an upload progress bar at the bottom of the page. Your download will start automatically when the file conversion is finished. If your download doesn't start automatically, click the green Download button next to your file's name.

steps.headline: Open Audacity on your computer.
steps.description: Audacity is a free and open-source audio editor app. You can download the app from www.audacityteam.org, and use it on Windows, Mac, and Linux.

steps.headline: Click the File tab.
steps.description: It's in the upper-left corner of your screen.

steps.headline: Click Open.
steps.description: This will allow you to select and open an audio file in Audacity.

steps.headline: Open the AIFF file you want to convert.
steps.description: Select your AIFF file in the dialogue box, and click Open to import it to Audacity.

steps.headline: Hover over Export on the file menu.
steps.description: This will show your export options.

steps.headline: Select Export as WAV.
steps.description: This will prompt you to select a location to save your WAV audio file export.

steps.headline: Select a saving location for your WAV file export.
steps.description: Click the folder where you want to save your WAV audio file, and click Save to confirm.

steps.headline: Enter any additional metadata for your WAV file (optional).
steps.description: You can add additional information to your WAV audio file such as an artist name, track title, year, or genre. This is an optional step. You can export your file without adding any metadata here.

steps.headline: Click OK.
steps.description: This will convert your AIFF audio file to WAV format, and save the WAV file to your selected export location.
